meanings.sent1: The solar panel produced only a milliwatt of electricity.
meanings.sent2: The flashlight bulb required a milliwatt of power to operate.
meanings.sent3: I tried to power my entire house with just a milliwatt, but it didn't work out.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was so soft, it was like a milliwatt in a sea of noise.
meanings.sent5: The tiny milliwatt of energy was barely enough to light a small LED bulb.

meanings.definition: A unit of power equal to one thousandth of a watt.
meanings.sent1: The electronic device consumed only a milliwatt of power per hour.
meanings.sent2: The wind turbine generated several milliwatts of electricity on a windy day.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally sneezed and blew away a milliwatt of power from the circuit.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a milliwatt, small but persistent in achieving his goals.
meanings.sent5: The milliwatt measurement on the power meter was crucial for monitoring energy usage.
